org.jlab.coda.et
Class EventImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.jlab.coda.et.EventImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Event
public class EventImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Event

This class defines an ET event.

Constructor Summary
EventImpl(int size)
          Creates an event object for users of Java-based ET systems or by the system itself.

Constructor Detail

EventImpl

public EventImpl(int size)
Creates an event object for users of Java-based ET systems or by the system itself. Event objects are only created once in the ET system process - when the ET system is started up.

Parameters:
size - size of the data array in bytes
Method Detail

init

public void init()
Initialize an event's fields. Called for an event each time it passes through GRAND_CENTRAL station.

Specified by:
init in interface Event

public int getId()
Gets the event's id number.

event's id number.

getAge

public Age getAge()
Gets the age of the event, either Age.NEW if a new event obtained through calling SystemUse.newEvents(org.jlab.coda.et.Attachment, int, int, int, int) or Age.USED if obtained through calling SystemUse.getEvents(org.jlab.coda.et.Attachment, int, int, int).

Specified by:
getAge in interface Event
Returns:
age of the event.

getGroup

public int getGroup()
Gets the group the event belongs to (1, 2, ...) if ET system events are divided into groups. If not, group = 1. Used so some producers don't hog events from others.

Specified by:
getGroup in interface Event
Returns:
the group the event belongs to.

getPriority

public Priority getPriority()
Gets the event's priority, either high Priority.HIGH or low Priority.LOW. Low priority is normal while high priority events get placed at the front of stations' input and output event lists.

Specified by:
getPriority in interface Event
Returns:
event's priority.

getOwner

public int getOwner()
Gets the attachment id of the attachment which owns or got the event. If it's owned by the system its value is Constants.system.

Specified by:
getOwner in interface Event
Returns:
id of owning attachment or Constants.system if system owns it

getLength

public int getLength()
Gets the length of the data in bytes.

Specified by:

Returns:
length of the data in bytes.

public int getMemSize()
Gets the size of the data buffer in bytes.

size of the data buffer in bytes

getSizeLimit

public int getSizeLimit()
Gets the size limit of the data buffer in bytes when using a C-based ET system.

Returns:
size size limit of the data buffer in bytes

getDataStatus

public DataStatus getDataStatus()
Gets the status of the data (set by the system), which can be OK DataStatus.OK, corrupted DataStatus.CORRUPT, or possibly corrupted DataStatus.POSSIBLYCORRUPT. Data is OK by default, it is never labeled as corrupt but can be labeled as possible corrupt if the process owning an event crashes and the system recovers it.

Specified by:
getDataStatus in interface Event
Returns:
status of the data.

getModify

public Modify getModify()
Gets the event's modify value when receiving it over the network. This specifies whether the user wants to read the event only, will modify only the event header (everything except the data), or will modify the data and/or header. Modifying the data and/or header is Modify.ANYTHING, modifying only the header is Modify.HEADER, else the default assumed, Modify.NOTHING, is that nothing is modified resulting in this event being put back into the ET system (by remote server) immediately upon being copied and that copy sent to the user.

Specified by:
getModify in interface Event
Returns:
event's modify value.

getByteOrder

public java.nio.ByteOrder getByteOrder()
Gets the event data's byte order.

Specified by:
getByteOrder in interface Event
Returns:
event data's byte order

getControl

public int[] getControl()
Gets the event's control array. This is an array of integers which can be used for any purpose by the user.

Specified by:
getControl in interface Event
Returns:
event's control array.

getData

public byte[] getData()
Gets the event's data array which is backing the event's data buffer.

setModify

public void setModify(Modify modify)
Sets whether the user wants to read the event only (default, 0), will modify only the event header Constants.modifyHeader, or will modify anything including the data Constants.modify. This is only relevant when talking to the Et system over the network.

Parameters:
modify -

setByteOrder

public void setByteOrder(int endian)
                  throws EtException
Set the event's byte order. Values can be Constants.endianBig, Constants.endianLittle, Constants.endianLocal, Constants.endianNotLocal, or Constants.endianSwitch

Specified by:
setByteOrder in interface Event
Parameters:
endian - endian value
Throws:
EtException - if argument is a bad value

setByteOrder

public void setByteOrder(java.nio.ByteOrder order)
Set the event's byte order.

Specified by:
setByteOrder in interface Event
Parameters:
order - endian value

setControl

public void setControl(int[] con)
                throws EtException
Sets the event's control array by copying it in.

Specified by:
setControl in interface Event
Parameters:
con - control array
Throws:
EtException - if control array has the wrong number of elements

setData

public void setData(byte[] data)
Sets the event's data without copying. The length and memSize members of the event are automatically set to the data array's length. Used only by local Java ET system in newEvents to increase data array size.

Parameters:
data - data array

setDataBuffer

public void setDataBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer dataBuffer)
Sets the event's data buffer (backed by data array).

Parameters:
dataBuffer - event's data buffer

needToSwap

public boolean needToSwap()
                   throws EtException
Tells caller if the event data needs to be swapped in order to be the correct byte order.

Specified by:
needToSwap in interface Event
Returns:
true if swapping is needed, otherwise false
Throws:
EtException - if the byte order has a bad value
